accession¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

description¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

gene_id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

id¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

multitime_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>¶
singletime_set¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

taxonomy¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

abundances.tables module¶

table module

class abundances.tables.ChattyColumn(attrs=None, checked=None, **extra)¶

Bases: django_tables2.columns.checkboxcolumn.CheckBoxColumn

modified CheckBoxColumn to have “onlick”:”sucess()” attributes

Used by javascript activate display button only if data are selected.

property header¶

The value used for the column heading (e.g. inside the <th> tag).

By default this returns ~.Column.verbose_name.

Returns

unicode or None

Note

This property typically is not accessed directly when a table is rendered. Instead, .BoundColumn.header is accessed which in turn accesses this property. This allows the header to fallback to the column name (it is only available on a .BoundColumn object hence accessing that first) when this property doesn’t return something useful.

render(value, bound_column, record)¶

Returns the content for a specific cell.

This method can be overridden by table.render_FOO methods on the table or by subclassing .Column.

If the value for this cell is in .empty_values, this method is skipped and an appropriate default value is rendered instead. Subclasses should set .empty_values to () if they want to handle all values in .render.

render(value)¶

Returns the content for a specific cell.

This method can be overridden by table.render_FOO methods on the table or by subclassing .Column.

If the value for this cell is in .empty_values, this method is skipped and an appropriate default value is rendered instead. Subclasses should set .empty_values to () if they want to handle all values in .render.

abundances.views module¶

Views for Regulatome App

This module demonstrates contains definitions of views for - the front page - tables, both for single and multitime data sets - plots - RESTful API

class abundances.views.DV(**kwargs)¶

Bases: rest_framework.views.APIView

Search form and filters for display individual entries from the multitime set. This is avoids lengthy loading of RESTful data and can be useful for demos. Not currently used.

authentication_classes = []¶
